bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Frank T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON , NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF the application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a writ of Habeas Corpus. No 3038 PETITIONER'S EXCEPTIONS
COMES NOW THE PETITIONER above named and excepts to the decision and order of the Court in the above enti tled matter, as follows;
(a) To the refusal of the court to grant the writ of Habeas Corpus as prayed and to discharge the petitioner from custody.

(b) To the finding and decision of the Court that the law of the State of Washington complained of in the petition is not in conflict with the provisions of Article XIV of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States.

(c) To the finding and decision of the Court that the said law of the State of Washington is not in conflict with the provisions of Article V of the Amendments to the Constiution of the United States.
(d) To the decision and order of the Court remanding the petitioner to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washington.
AND PRAYS that the said exceptions and each of them may be allowed by the Court and made part of the record in said cause.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Attorney for Petitioner 419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
div1.p: The foregoing exceptions are hereby allowed and ordered to be made part of the record in said cause.
By the Court. Sep. 30th 1915.
ORIGINAL No. 3038
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In Re application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Service of within Exception htis 30th day of Sept 1915 and receipt of a copy thereof, admitted,
div1.ab: Frank P. Helsell Attorneys for Respdt
div1.p: Appellant's Exceptions
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION SEP301915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: 2x
Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Appellant
Telephone: Elliott 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS"
